_comment: Created by ianb on 17/01/2014 17:27:39 using v2.0
title: How have the number of maternities changed over time?
analysis_commentary: The absolute number of maternities where it is known that the woman is a smoker at time of birth has also been decreasing. In 2012/13 roughly 83,500 women were known to be smokers, a decrease of over 7,000 since 2006/07. This decrease in number has happened despite a general increase in the total number of maternities.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Women's Smoking Status at Time of Delivery
